Field Detail

checkForNull

boolean checkForNull
Indicates that a pointer check can to be removed.

dontPush

boolean dontPush
Valid for an aload that will be consumed by a putfield. For aload indicates that aload will be consumed by a putfield that knows what is going on and doesn't need the address on the stack. For putfield indicates that aload was not performed, use localSlot.

classInitialized

boolean classInitialized

localSlot

int localSlot
Indicates the originating local variable slot if known, else -1
Constructor Detail

CodeAnnotation

CodeAnnotation()
Create an annotation to a bytecode instruction. The annotaions carry information during code generation obtained during code analysis. The is one CodeAnnotion for every bytecode that needs special consideration.

CodeAnnotation

CodeAnnotation(int l,
               boolean checked)
Method Detail

isNullCheckNeeded

static boolean isNullCheckNeeded(CodeAnnotation[] annotations,
                                 int index)
Indicate whether a null check is needed. No annotation means that a null check is needed.

getLocalSlot

static int getLocalSlot(CodeAnnotation[] annotations,
                        int index)
Return the local variable slot associated with this instruction index if known.

dontPush

static boolean dontPush(CodeAnnotation[] annotations,
                        int index)
Return the dontPush associated with this instruction index if known. No annotation means that we do push.

classInitialized

static boolean classInitialized(CodeAnnotation[] annotations,
                                int index)
Returns true if class is already initialized. No annotation means that class needs initialization. This method is only valid for op_putfield, op_getfield, op_invokevirtual, op_invokestatic and op_new.
